p: Influenza A viruses are the causative agents of annual epidemics of respiratory disease and occasionally generate pandemics with variable consequences for human health and the global economy ( 1). The 1918 pandemic caused some 50 million deaths ( 2), while the last pandemic, in 2009, was much milder and a normal yearly epidemic causes up to 500,000 deaths worldwide ( http://www.who.int/mediacentre/factsheets/fs211/en/).
